definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
spirit wall (screen wall used to shield an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture)
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple
Jiepang (Chinese location-based social networking service for mobile devices, in operation 2010-2016)
